alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 8:01AM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Chocolay River near Harvey affecting Marquette County. .Recent rainfall and snowmelt have led to an increase in water levels for the Chocolay River near Harvey. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Chocolay River near Harvey. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water begins to inundate the parking lot where M-28 crosses the Chocolay River...as well as low lying areas along Timber Lane and towards the mouth of the river * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 9.90 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 100 PM EDT.
